review: When I was buying this at my local Apple retail store, the rep told me it could play directly from my NAS (network-attached storage). When I got home, I realized she had either lied to me or simply hadn't got a clue.  The Computer part of Apple TV only streams from iTunes software on Mac or PC.However, with the help of a free app called MoliPlayer HD -- I first used this app last year on my Nokia Windows Phone -- and the wonderful AirPlay, it's a cinch to network-play my files on my NAS, a Diskstation product.  MoliPlayer HD can access any server or computer on your LAN (local area network), and play pretty all the video and audio formats out there.  The free version doesn't allow you to password-protect the app, but otherwise has all the major functions.  I just launch MoliPlayer HD, go to Nearby on the left, and it accesses my DiskStation as well as my Windows workgroup immediately. I then turn on AirPlay to send the media content to my Apple TV.The Apple TV is truly simple and elegant, and it just works.  I went through several Android-based media players but they were all difficult to use, froze frequently, not to mention anything from Google is reported to spy on you and your family.  On the Apple TV I can rearrange the app icons just like on iPhone or iPad. I can easily get rid off unwanted icons through the Restrictions settings. For instance, I don't have cable at home, so I remove things like HBO and ESPN and Disney channels.  Everything just works so well and so smoothly, even the screensaver is so well done.  AirPlay is indeed awesome!!  I plan to get an AirPort Extreme and AirPlay-ify all my media hardware.
